update.description: This PR is bringing in the align tool functionality (for Citadel, this will only incorporate the center align due to API breaking changes being required for min and max align).
update.title: Align Tool

content.raw: We should remove the `SetMaterial` calls like we did for highlight. This may not work with Ogre 1, but the issue is upstream.
content.html: We should remove the SetMaterial calls like we did for highlight. This may not work with Ogre 1, but the issue is upstream.

update.description: This PR is bringing in the align tool functionality (for Citadel, this will only incorporate the center align due to API breaking changes being required for min and max align).
update.title: Align Tool

content.raw: I did have an `AlignConfig` enum class for mid, max, and min, but took them out for Citadel since the align is always going to align to the center for Citadel. My plan is to add them back for Dome after AABB is added.
content.html: I did have an AlignConfig enum class for mid, max, and min, but took them out for Citadel since the align is always going to align to the center for Citadel. My plan is to add them back for Dome after AABB is added.

content.raw: Not critical, but these could have something like `MID`, since we'll add `MIN` and `MAX` soon
content.html: Not critical, but these could have something like MID, since we'll add MIN and MAX soon

content.raw: Nit: it's usually preferable to include the most specific header you can
content.html: Nit: it's usually preferable to include the most specific header you can

content.raw:
‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3409704326-align.gif)
^ Example of first and last, confirming an align along the z axis with the corresponding physics.

‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3377369729-align2.gif)
^ Example of multiple align and first and last.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1922015471-align3.gif)
^ Example of a node being able to align to a visual, but a visual not being able to align to a node.
content.html:
‌

^ Example of first and last, confirming an align along the z axis with the corresponding physics.

‌

^ Example of multiple align and first and last.

^ Example of a node being able to align to a visual, but a visual not being able to align to a node.

update.description:
This PR is bringing in the align tool functionality (for Citadel, this will only incorporate the center align due to API breaking changes being required for min and max align).

* Sync with target branch once the selection forward port (#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/539) is made as this branch has old selection code
update.title: Align Tool + Select to Citadel

update.description:
This PR is bringing in the align tool functionality (for Citadel, this will only incorporate the center align due to API breaking changes being required for min and max align).

**TODO:**

* Docs
* Polish up state code possibly with use of more enum classes
* Remove commented min/max code not able to be placed on citadel
* Changed hovered function to OnEntered and OnExited functions
* Merge finalized selection PR into this one
* More testing with selection from Entity Tree
* Sync with target branch once the selection forward port (#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/539) is made
update.title: [WIP] Align Tool + Select to Citadel

update.description:
This PR is bringing in the align tool functionality (for Citadel, this will only incorporate the center align due to API breaking changes being required for min and max align).

Since align needs entity selection, I merged the current progress into this branch ([ign-gazebo#543](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/534)).

**TODO:**

* Docs
* Polish up state code possibly with use of more enum classes
* Remove commented min/max code not able to be placed on citadel
* Changed hovered function to OnEntered and OnExited functions
* Merge finalized selection PR into this one
* More testing with selection from Entity Tree
update.title: [WIP] Align Tool + Select to Citadel
